titleStmt.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to James G. Blaine, January 1, 1890

bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to James G. Blaine
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, January 1st, 1890.

Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith,
To the Department of State.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, January 1st, 1890.

Honorable James G. Blaine,
Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.

I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of Department Circular of November 11th, 1889, with reference to the laws and regulations on the manufacture and sale of wine, beer and similar fermented liquors.
I have complied with the instructions contained in said Circular, and beg to state that neither wine nor beer of any description is manufactured or fermented in Liberia.

I am,
sir,
your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith.
